description: Thousands have been rallying in Khabarovsk to demand their governor be returned for a fair trial.
title: Sergei Furgal: The arrest fuelling anti-Moscow anger in Russia's far east
title_page: Sergei Furgal: The arrest fuelling anti-Moscow anger in Russia's far east - BBC News
maintext: In 2018 Mr Furgal ran for governor of Khabarovsk region, but was widely seen as a technical candidate, with little chance - or even desire - to win. Due to a massive protest vote against Moscow, Mr Furgal trounced the Kremlin's candidate. As governor he became a charismatic, tough-talking and popular politician. Many here tell me he is more popular in the region than President Putin.
